meanings.definition: Synchronization: the act of causing things to occur or operate at the same time or rate
meanings.sent1: The synchro of the traffic lights made sure all cars stopped together.
meanings.sent2: The synchro of the dancers' movements impressed the audience.
meanings.sent3: The synchro of the alarm clocks going off at the same time startled everyone.
meanings.sent4: The synchro of the birds flying in perfect formation was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The synchro of the synchronized swimmers was mesmerizing to watch.

meanings.definition: Synchronous: occurring at the same time; simultaneous
meanings.sent1: The synchronous clapping of the audience showed their appreciation.
meanings.sent2: The synchronous arrival of the guests made the party lively.
meanings.sent3: The synchronous barking of the dogs startled the neighbors.
meanings.sent4: Their synchronous laughter filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The synchronous blinking of the fireflies lit up the night.
